de.gianfelice.aeskulab.system.authentication
Class User

java.lang.Object
  de.gianfelice.aeskulab.system.persistence.PersistentObject
      de.gianfelice.aeskulab.system.authentication.User
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
@Entity
public final class User
extends PersistentObject

Entity class for users. This class keeps information about registered users.

Version:
3.6.0
Author:
Kim (http://code.google.com/p/vaadin-appfoundation), Matthias Gianfelice
See Also:
User, Serialized Form

          Whether the user is an administrator.

Constructor Detail

User

public User()
An empty constructor which is accessible by all classes in the project.

User

protected User(java.lang.String firstName,
               java.lang.String lastName,
               java.lang.String email,
               java.lang.String password)
A protected constructor which is used to create new users.

Parameters:
firstName - The first name of the user
lastName - The last name of the user
email - The email of the new user
password - The password of the new user (the hash will be automatically generated)

User

protected User(java.lang.String firstName,
               java.lang.String lastName,
               java.lang.String email,
               java.lang.String password,
               boolean admin)
A protected constructor which is used to create the first user.

Parameters:
firstName - The first name of the user
lastName - The last name of the user
email - The email of the new user
password - The password of the new user (the hash will be automatically generated)
admin - Whether the new user should be an administrator or not

isPassword

protected boolean isPassword(java.lang.String password)
                      throws TooManyFailedLoginsException
Returns whether the given password matches the real one. This method is only accessible by package-members to ensure cracking the password is not too easy.

Parameters:
password - the password
Returns:
Whether the password matches the saved one
Throws:
TooManyFailedLoginsException - When the password was wrong too many times, this exception will be thrown
See Also:
MAX_FAILED_LOGINS

setPassword

public boolean setPassword(java.lang.String password,
                           java.lang.String oldPassword)
                    throws TooManyFailedLoginsException
Sets the password for the user.

Parameters:
password - the password
oldPassword - the old password
Returns:
Whether the inlogged user is privileged, the old password was correct and the given new password is valid
Throws:
TooManyFailedLoginsException - Will be thrown, if there were too many attempts to check the password
See Also:
MAX_FAILED_LOGINS

setPassword

public boolean setPassword(java.lang.String password)
Sets the password for the user by an administrator.

Parameters:
password - the password
Returns:
Whether the inlogged user is an administrator and therefore privileged to change the password without providing the old password and the given password is valid

isAdmin

public boolean isAdmin()
Returns true, if the user is an administrator, otherwise it returns false.

Returns:
Whether the user is an administrator

setAdmin

public void setAdmin(boolean admin)
Tries to set the administrator-flag for the user. The user can't change it's own status to prevent a situation without any administrators.

Parameters:
admin - the new admin

getImage

public java.io.File getImage()
Returns the image of the user.

Returns:
The image of the user or null, if there is none.
See Also:
FileUtil

setImage

public void setImage(java.io.File image)
Sets the image of the current user.

Parameters:
image - The image of the user

isBlocked

public boolean isBlocked()
Checks, whether the user is blocked because of too many login attempts.

Returns:
True, if the user is blocked, otherwise false

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object

isUserPrivileged

private boolean isUserPrivileged()
Checks, whether the current user is privileged to change a value in this object.

Returns:
Whether the current inlogged user is equal to this user or the inlogged user is an administrator
